articles.title: About
articles.contents:
Nicola Rennie is a statistician and data scientist, passionate about using R to solve problems. She currently works as a Data Scientist at Jumping Rivers, having previously been a Mathematical Consultant at the Smith Institute. Nicola completed her PhD in statistics and operational research at STOR-i CDT at Lancaster University, where she researched the use of outlier detection in decision support systems in collaboration with Deutsche Bahn, Lufthansa, and Swiss Airlines.
Experience
Jumping Rivers | Data Scientist | Nov 2021 - Present
Smith Institute | Mathematical Consultant | Aug 2021 - Nov 2021
Lancaster University | Graduate Teaching Assistant | Oct 2018 - Jun 2021
Education
Lancaster University | PhD in Statistics and Operational Research | Oct 2018 - Oct 2021
Lancaster University | MRes in Statistics and Operational Research | Oct 2017 - Oct 2018
University of St Andrews | Bsc (Hons) in Mathematics | Sep 2014 - Jun 2017
Skills
R | Python | Markdown | LaTeX | Git
Forecasting | Classification | Outlier detection | Data visualisation

articles.title: Work
articles.contents:
Publications
Detecting demand outliers in transport systems  N. Rennie | PhD Thesis | 2021  eprints.lancs.ac.uk/2021renniephd.pdf
Identifying and responding to outlier demand in revenue management  N. Rennie, C. Cleophas, A.M. Sykulski et al. | European Journal of Operational Research | 2021  doi: doi.org/10.1016/j.ejor.2021.01.002
Detecting outlying demand in multi-leg bookings for transportation networks  N. Rennie, C. Cleophas, A.M. Sykulski et al. | Under revision | 2021  pre-print: arxiv.org/abs/2104.04157
Analysing and visualising bike sharing demand with outliers  N. Rennie, C. Cleophas, A.M. Sykulski et al. | Under revision | 2021
We’re not getting any younger! Or should that be older?  N. Rennie | Significance | Upcoming online | 2021
Awards
Finalist of the 2021 Statistical Excellence Award for Early-Career Writing | Significance and the RSS Young Statisticians Section | Jul 2021
Nick Smith Prize for Research Excellence | Lancaster University | Aug 2020
LUMS Research Conference Doctoral Poster Competition (3rd place) | Lancaster University | Sep 2019

Other
Volunteer Contributor | Viz For Social Good | Sep 2021 - Present  Leveraging the power of data visualisation to support non-profit organisations.
44th Research Students’ Conference in Probability and Statistics | Member of the Organising Committee | Jan 2020 - Jul 2021  In my role in marketing and publicity, I designed the conference website, produced marketing materials, and collaborated with universities to attract postgraduate participants.
